item.description: TLDR ls parsing bad, do this ls -1iq | grep -o '^ *[0-9]*' # get file inodes find /path/to/search -inum <inode_number> # convert inodes to file info You can continue your doomscroll now ğŸ‘ğŸ¼ You still here? (thanks!! ğŸ˜‡) ok, then read on: Do you know why its not recommended to parse ls output for operation on a list of files? It’s because the UNIX system allows any characters in filenames so things like newline, whitespaces, ~ (and a lot more weird chars) are all valid.
